sentences.english: Meanwhile, Master Roshi is confronted by an old rival.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，龜仙人又遇到了他的一個老對手。

sentences.english: Since then, I have more admiration for the immortal hill.
sentences.chinese: 以後，我更敬佩仙人山了。

sentences.english: The Loggia overlooks the cactus garden and outdoor fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 長廊眺望仙人掌花園和戶外壁爐。

sentences.english: The dwarf sat down and the elf rang the little brass bell.
sentences.chinese: 侏儒坐下來，而小仙人搖了那小銅鈴。

sentences.english: They include the endangered Mexican Wolf and giant Saguaro cactus.
sentences.chinese: 包括了瀕危的墨西哥狼和巨大的薩掛諾仙人掌。

sentences.english: This paper reported a study on the purification and preliminary analysis of polysaccharides of Opuntia Vulgaris Mill.
sentences.chinese: 本文報導了仙人掌多糖的分離純化及初步分析。

sentences.english: The reason is that i planted my cactus on the land.
sentences.chinese: 原因是，我在這塊地上種下了我的小仙人球。

sentences.english: Cave Restaurant is the only place under the sun that sells shrimp and scallop dumplings.
sentences.chinese: 出售蝦仁彎梳餃的仙人居餐館，天下獨此一家。

sentences.english: Where can I watch Cactus movie online free full stream?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪裏可以在線看電影免費仙人掌充分流？

sentences.english: Why let a few cactuses tell you what to think?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼讓幾枝仙人掌左右了你的想法？

sentences.english: Objective To observe the effect of extract of Cactus on the proliferate of T-lymphocyte in mice.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討仙人掌提取物對小鼠T淋巴細胞增殖的影響。

sentences.english: Farther away, there are some small bushes and cactus.
sentences.chinese: 在遠一點，有了小灌木和仙人掌。

sentences.english: His room is full of cactuses.
sentences.chinese: 他的房裏放滿了仙人掌。

sentences.english: Beautiful succulents fill huge Urns atop the entry court walls.
sentences.chinese: 大門庭院牆上立着大缸，滿滿是美麗的仙人掌。

sentences.english: Cactuses are used to living in desert.
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌通常生長在沙漠裏。

sentences.english: Now, I have grown up, but the fairy mountain is still accompany me.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我已經長大了，但仙人山仍陪伴在我身邊。

definition: Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
lower bound (math.)/world of mortals/(of Gods) to descend to the world of mortals
underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
